page.title: 03THE BELLS,WISBOROUGH GREEN
page.content: The church of St.Peter ad Vincula has a ring of six bells. The third, fourth and fifth were originally cast in 1656. The tenor was cast in 1669 by William Eldridge, probably at a foundry in Horsham. In 1928 the fourth was recast by Taylors of Lough borough and the ring was made up to six by the addition of the treble and second, cast at the same foundry in 1928. The ring ws re-tuned and the wooden bell-frame was replaced by a steel frame. Steel headstocks replaced the original wooden ones in 1973. The bells are rung before Morning Service on Sundays, for weddings and on special occasions. West Sussex Ringers rang a Quarterpeal of plain doubles on April 20th,1985 - 1026 changes. A peal of The Tower Method Wisborough Green Place Doubles will be rung during 1985.
